Bison

Bison

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 36 (4d10)
Speed: walk 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
17 (+3)10 (+0)16 (+3)5 (-3)8 (-1)4 (-3)
Skills: Athletics
Druid Level: 6
Bloodied Rage. When the bison is bloodied, its weapon attack rolls have advantage.
Group Defense. The bison can't be flanked while it has an ally with the Group Defense trait within 5 feet of it that isn't incapacitated.
Poor Sight. The bison has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Powerful Build. The bison counts as one size larger than its actual size for the purpose of grappling and being grappled, determining its carrying capacity, and determining the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

Attacks

Horns. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d10 + 3 piercing damage, and if the target is smaller than the bison, it is pushed up to 10 feet and knocked prone

Special Actions

(3 AP) Trampling Charge. The bison moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement. During this movement, it can enter the spaces of smaller creatures. If it enters the space of a prone creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 bludgeoning damage. If it enters the space of a non-prone creature, it makes a Horns attack against it.
○
×
Rhinoceros

Rhinoceros

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 18 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 60 (6d10)
Speed: walk 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
20 (+5)7 (-2)19 (+4)4 (-3)7 (-2)4 (-3)
Skills: Athletics
Druid Level: 6
Bloodied Rage. When the rhinoceros is bloodied, its weapon attack rolls have advantage.
Poor Sight. The rhinoceros has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Powerful Build. The rhinoceros counts as one size larger than its actual size for the purpose of grappling and being grappled, determining its carrying capacity, and determining the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

Attacks

Horn. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d12 + 5 piercing damage, and if the target is the same size or smaller than the rhinoceros, it is pushed up to 10 feet and knocked prone

Special Actions

(3 AP) Trampling Charge. The rhinoceros moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement. During this movement, it can enter the spaces of smaller creatures. If it enters the space of a prone creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 bludgeoning damage. If it enters the space of a non-prone creature, it makes a Horns attack against it.

○
×
reach

Reach

A reach weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it.
○
×
Pygmy Elephant

Pygmy Elephant

Medium Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 21 (3d8)
Speed: walk 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
16 (+3)11 (+0)14 (+2)7 (-2)12 (+1)6 (-2)
Skills: Athletics
Druid Level: 6
Cooperative Riding. A friendly creature riding the elephant benefits from the Group Defense trait, so the elephant and rider can't be flanked as long as neither is incapacitated.
Group Defense. The elephant can't be flanked while it has an ally with the Group Defense trait within 5 feet of it that isn't incapacitated.

Attacks

Tusk. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d10 + 3 piercing damage, and if the target is smaller than the elephant, it is pushed up to 5 feet.
Trunk. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 3 bludgeoning damage, and if the target is smaller than the elephant, it is grappled. If the target is smaller by two or more sizes, it is restrained while grappled in this way.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Quick Grab. The elephant makes a Trunk attack.

Crocodile

Crocodile

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 15 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 21 (3d10)
Speed: walk 30 ft., swim 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
15 (+2)10 (+0)13 (+1)5 (-3)14 (+2)5 (-3)
Skills: Athletics, Perception, Stealth
Senses: darkvision 60 ft.
Druid Level: 6
Hold Breath. The crocodile can hold its breath for up to 1 hour.
Powerful Jaws. A creature grappled by the crocodile's Bite has disadvantage on saving throws made to escape.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d8 + 2 piercing damage, and if the target the same size as the crocodile or smaller, it is grappled. While grappled in this way, the target is also restrained.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Clench Teeth. If the crocodile has a creature grappled by its Bite, the creature takes 1d4 piercing damage.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The crocodile makes 2 Bite attacks.
(3 AP) Death Roll. The crocodile spins violently in water to devastate its prey. It must be swimming to use this action. A creature grappled by the crocodile's Bite makes a DC 12 Strength saving throw, taking 4d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.
○
×
Stone Snail

Stone Snail

Small Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 18 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 5 (1d6)
Speed: walk 5 ft., climb 5 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
6 (-2)4 (-3)12 (+1)2 (-4)10 (+0)1 (-5)
Druid Level: 6
Cling Climb. The snail can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
False Appearance. While the snail remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rock.
Stony Slime. The snail leaves behind a coat of slime when it moves. The slime turns to a hard, stone-like substance as it dries over the course of a minute. The slime can be preserved in its liquid form if it is scraped off and kept in an air-tight container, such as a vial. It takes 10 feet's worth of scraping to collect an ounce of slime.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Withdraw. The snail withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges as a free action, it can't attack, it's prone, it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it gains a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
○
×
Viper

Viper

Tiny Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 13
Hit Points: 3 (1d4)
Speed: climb 15 ft., crawl 15 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
3 (-4)16 (+3)10 (+0)3 (-4)12 (+1)2 (-4)
Saving Throws: Str
Skills: Stealth
Senses: blindsight 10 ft.
Druid Level: 6
Keen Smell. The snake has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.
Poor Hearing and Sight. The snake has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 1d6 poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned (save ends). While poisoned in this way, the target takes ongoing 1d6 poison damage and is incapacitated due to intense pain.
○
×
Python

Python

Medium Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 11
Hit Points: 21 (3d8)
Speed: climb 15 ft., crawl 15 ft., swim 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
16 (+3)12 (+1)14 (+2)3 (-4)12 (+1)3 (-4)
Saving Throws: Str
Skills: Athletics, Stealth
Senses: blindsight 10 ft.
Druid Level: 6
Keen Smell. The snake has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.
Poor Hearing and Sight. The snake has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d4 + 3 piercing damage, and the target is grappled.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Constrict. The python wraps itself around a creature it is grappling with its Bite. The creature is restrained for the duration of the grapple if it is the same size as the python or smaller. While restrained in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Strength saving throws made to escape the grapple.
(1 AP) Crush. The python tightens its grasp around a creature it is restraining with its Constrict. The target takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage and begins suffocating until the end of the python's next turn or until it's no longer restrained by the python.

×
Akararyx

Akararyx

Small Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 8 (2d6)
Speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
6 (-2)16 (+3)11 (+0)6 (-2)15 (+2)5 (-3)
Skills: Acrobatics, Athletics, Perception
Druid Level: 6
Glide. While not suitable for true flight, the akaryx's wings allow it to glide. For each foot it descends vertically, it can spend 1 foot of movement to move 2 feet horizontally.
Keen Sight. The akararyx has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Natural Immunity. The akararyx is immune to disease.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 3 piercing damage.
Claw. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d4 + 3 slashing damage.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The akararyx makes a Bite attack and a Claw attack.
(3 AP) Pounce. The akararyx moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement, and then makes a Claw attack. If the akararyx moved at least 10 feet and the attack hits, the target is grappled and the akararyx can additionally make a Bite attack against it.
»
○
×
taunted

Taunted

While taunted by a creature, you have disadvantage on attacks against all creatures except the one taunting you.
If a creature taunts you while you are already taunted, the first taunt ends.
This condition can be commonly applied via the Taunt action.
»
○
×
Taunt

Taunt

Cost: 2 AP (repeatable)
You attempt to goad one creature within 60 feet of you into attacking you. Make a Deception, Performance, or Persuasion check, which becomes your Taunt DC. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Taunt DC or be taunted by you until the end of your next turn. A target that can't see or hear you automatically succeeds on the save.
»
○
×
Help

Help

Cost: 2 AP (repeatable)
You can lend your aid to another creature in the completion of a task. When you take the Help action, the creature you aid gains advantage on the next ability check it makes to perform the task you are helping with, provided that it makes the check before the start of your next turn.
Alternatively, you can aid a friendly creature in attacking a creature within 5 feet of you. You feint, distract the target, or in some other way team up to make your ally's attack more effective. If your ally attacks the target before your next turn, the first attack roll is made with advantage.
○
×
Monkey

Monkey

Tiny Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 13
Hit Points: 3 (1d4)
Speed: walk 30 ft., climb 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
6 (-2)17 (+3)10 (+0)6 (-2)13 (+1)6 (-2)
Saving Throws: Str
Skills: Acrobatics, Athletics, Perception
Druid Level: 6

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Distract. The monkey uses the Taunt action targeting one creature within 5 feet of one of the monkey's allies. That ally can use its reaction to move without provoking opportunity attacks from the target of the Taunt, regardless of the Taunt's outcome.
(1 AP) Harass. The monkey uses the Help action to aid an ally's attack.
○
×
Bush Ape

Armor Class: 13 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 21 (3d8)
Speed: walk 30 ft., climb 20 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
18 (+4)14 (+2)14 (+2)7 (-2)13 (+1)7 (-2)
Saving Throws: Str
Skills: Perception, Athletics ×2
Druid Level: 6
Savage Assault. The ape has advantage on attack rolls against a target it is grappling.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d8 + 4 piercing damage.
Smack. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d6 + 4 bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The ape makes two Smack attacks and a Bite attack.
(2 AP) Hurl Debris. The ape makes an improvised attack by throwing a rock or stick.

Fly

Fly

Minuscule Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 13
Hit Points: 1 (1d1)
Speed: walk 5 ft., climb 5 ft., fly 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
1 (-5)16 (+3)8 (-1)1 (-5)13 (+1)1 (-5)
Saving Throws: Dex, Con
Druid Level: 6
Evasive Flight. If the fly is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It must be flying to use this trait.
Flyby. The fly doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies.
»
○
×
Dodge

Dodge

Cost: 2 AP
When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.
○
×
Butterfly

Butterfly

Minuscule Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 10
Hit Points: 1 (1d1)
Speed: walk 5 ft., climb 5 ft., fly 20 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
1 (-5)10 (+0)9 (-1)1 (-5)8 (-1)1 (-5)
Druid Level: 6
Bright Colors. The butterfly has disadvantage on Stealth checks.

Special Actions

(0 AP) Erratic Flight. The butterfly flies and takes the Dodge action. It loses the benefits of the Dodge action early if it stops flying.
»
○
×
cover

Cover

Walls, trees, creatures, and other obstacles can provide cover during combat, making a target more difficult to harm. A target can benefit from cover only when an attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of the cover.
There are three degrees of cover. If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies; the degrees aren't added together. For example, if a target is behind a creature that gives half cover and a tree trunk that gives three-quarters cover, the target has three-quarters cover.

Half Cover

A target with half cover has a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target has half cover if an obstacle blocks at least half of its body. The obstacle might be a low wall, a large piece of furniture, a narrow tree trunk, or a creature, whether that creature is an enemy or a friend.

Three-Quarters Cover

A target with three-quarters cover has a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target has three-quarters cover if about three-quarters of it is covered by an obstacle. The obstacle might be a portcullis, an arrow slit, or a thick tree trunk.

Total Cover

A target with total cover can't be targeted directly by an attack or a spell, although some spells can reach such a target by including it in an area of effect. A target has total cover if it is completely concealed by an obstacle.
»
○
×
hidden

Hidden

While you are hidden from a creature, you gain the following benefits:
  • You have a Hide DC, which is typically determined by the Hide action. If you move without sneaking, you must reroll the Hide DC by making another Dexterity (Stealth) check.
  • The creature can't see you.
  • The creature can't track your movement.
You cease to be hidden from the creature immediately after any of the following occurrences:
  • You make a sound louder than a whisper.
  • Another creature reveals your location.
  • You make an attack roll or cast a spell with a verbal component
  • You aren't heavily obscured or behind any cover.
  • The creature succeeds on a Wisdom (Perception) check against your Hide DC. The Search action lets a creature attempt this check.
  • Your Hide DC becomes less than the creature's passive PerceptionAlso see the rule on Passive Perception Falloff..
This condition is typically obtained via the Hide action.
»
○
×
Hide

Hide

Cost: 2 AP (repeatable)
The Hide action allows you to attempt to become hidden from one or more creatures. Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check. If you are heavily obscured or behind at least three-quarters cover relative to a creature, and your check equals or exceeds its passive Perception score, you become hidden from it. The result of the check also becomes your Hide DC, as described in the condition.
»
○
×
exhaustion

Exhaustion

This condition is cumulative. Each time you receive it, you gain a specified number of levels of exhaustion. You die if your exhaustion level exceeds 10. While you have at least 1 level of exhaustion, you experience the following effects:
  • When you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you subtract your exhaustion level from the d20 roll.
  • Subtract your exhaustion level from the spell save DC of any spell you cast.
A common source of exhaustion is dropping to 0 hit points, and resting can increase or decrease your exhaustion.
»
○
×
blinded

Blinded

While blinded, you can't see anything.

Charmed

While charmed, you experience the following effects:
  • You can't attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful abilities or magical effects.
  • The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with you.

Concentration

Some spells and other effects require you to maintain concentration in order to keep them active. If you lose concentration, such an effect ends. You can also choose to end concentration on any effect at any time (no action required).
If a spell must be maintained with concentration, that fact appears in its Duration entry, and the spell specifies how long you can concentrate on it.
Normal activity, such as moving and attacking, doesn't interfere with concentration. The following factors can break concentration:
  • You lose concentration if you invoke another effect that requires concentration. You can't concentrate on two effects at once.
  • Whenever you take damage while you are concentrating, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration. The DC equals 10 or half the damage you take, whichever number is higher. If you take damage from multiple sources, such as an arrow and a dragon's breath, you make a separate saving throw for each source of damage.
  • You lose concentration on an effect if you are incapacitated or if you die.
  • Certain environmental phenomena, such as a wave crashing over you while you're on a storm-tossed ship, may require you to succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration. This is at your DM's discretion.

Dazed

While you are dazed, you experience the following effects:
  • On each of your turns, you have 1 less action point, and you can't take the Move action.
  • You can't take reactions.
  • You have disadvantage on saving throws you make to maintain concentration (including on the saving throw triggered by the effect that dazed you, if it triggered such a save).

Deafened

While deafened, you can't hear anything.

Dying

While you are dying, make a death saving throw at the start of each of your turns. Keep track of your successes and failures. You automatically suffer 1 failure each time you take damage while dying, or 2 failures if the damage was from a critical hit. If you reach 3 failures, you die. If you reach 3 successes, you stop dying. If you stop dying for any reason, stop tracking your successes and failures; the counts don't carry over to the next time you are dying.
If you aren't already dying, you start dying when you are reduced to 0 hit pointsYou also fall unconscious. and there is at least 1 point of excess damage. The condition ends early if you regain hit points. A creature within 5 feet of you can also make a DC 10 Medicine check to stabilize you as a standard action, ending the condition on a success.

Exhaustion

This condition is cumulative. Each time you receive it, you gain a specified number of levels of exhaustion. You die if your exhaustion level exceeds 10. While you have at least 1 level of exhaustion, you experience the following effects:
  • When you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you subtract your exhaustion level from the d20 roll.
  • Subtract your exhaustion level from the spell save DC of any spell you cast.
A common source of exhaustion is dropping to 0 hit points, and resting can increase or decrease your exhaustion.

Flanked

While you are flanked, melee attack rolls against you have advantage.
You are flanked if there are at least two non-incapacitated enemies on opposite sides of you. Creatures with blindsight, tremorsense, or multiple heads are immune to this condition.

Frightened

While frightened, you experience the following effects:
  • You have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of your fear is within line of sight.
  • You can't willingly move closer to the source of your fear.
This condition can be commonly applied via the Frighten action.

Grappling

While you are grappling another creature (the grappled creature), you experience the following effects:
  • Your speed is halved if you are the same size as the grappled creature, or 0 if you are smaller.
  • When you move, you drag the grappled creature with you.
  • If you are the same size as the grappled creature or larger, you can move it to another space within your reach as a free action.
You can end the grapple at any time, no action required. The grapple also ends if you become incapacitated or if the grappled creature is no longer within your reach.
This condition is typically caused by the grapple attack.

Grappled

While you are grappled by another creature (the grappling creature), you experience the following effects:
  • Your speed is halved if you are one size larger than the grappling creature, or 0 if you are the same size or smaller.
  • When you move, you drag the grappling creature with you.
As a standard action, you can make a saving throw against the grapple, ending the grapple on a success. The DC equals the grappler's passive Athletics score. You can also make this save as a reaction when you are moved by the grappler.
This condition is typically inflicted by the grapple attack.

Hidden

While you are hidden from a creature, you gain the following benefits:
  • You have a Hide DC, which is typically determined by the Hide action. If you move without sneaking, you must reroll the Hide DC by making another Dexterity (Stealth) check.
  • The creature can't see you.
  • The creature can't track your movement.
You cease to be hidden from the creature immediately after any of the following occurrences:
  • You make a sound louder than a whisper.
  • Another creature reveals your location.
  • You make an attack roll or cast a spell with a verbal component
  • You aren't heavily obscured or behind any cover.
  • The creature succeeds on a Wisdom (Perception) check against your Hide DC. The Search action lets a creature attempt this check.
  • Your Hide DC becomes less than the creature's passive PerceptionAlso see the rule on Passive Perception Falloff..
This condition is typically obtained via the Hide action.

Incapacitated

While incapacitated, you experience the following effects:
  • You can't take actions or reactions.
  • Your concentration is broken and you can't regain concentration.
  • You can't speak.

Invisible

While invisible, you can't be seen without the aid of magic or a special sense. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying similarly can't be seen.

Old Age

While you are older than your old age threshold, you have 1 permanent level of exhaustion. As you continue to age, you gain an additional permanent level of exhaustion for every number of years equal to your aging rate. These levels of exhaustion vanish immediately to reflect changes in your age or if you gain immunity to old age.
See the see the "Age" trait of your racial statblock for your old age threshold and aging rate.

Ongoing Damage

Ongoing damage is damage that you take at the end of each of your turns. When ongoing damage is save ends, make the saving throw first; you take no damage on a successful save.

Paralyzed

While paralyzed, you experience the following effects:
  • You are incapacitated.
  • You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage.
  • Any attack that hits you is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of you.

Petrified

While petrified, you experience the following effects:
  • You are transformed into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone). Your game statistics are the same as your original form.
  • Your weight increases by a factor of ten, and you cease aging.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage.
  • You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
  • You have resistance to all damage.
  • You are immune to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in your system is suspended, not neutralized.

Poisoned

While poisoned, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Prone

While prone, you experience the following effects:
  • The only movement mode available to you is crawling.
  • You have disadvantage on attack rolls.
  • An attack roll against you has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of you. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.
You can end this condition by standing up, which requires spending half of your walk speed when you move.
This condition is commonly caused by falling, falling unconscious, and the trip attack.

Restrained

While restrained, you experience the following effects:
  • Your speed is 0.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage, and your attack rolls have disadvantage.
  • You have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Slowed

While you are slowed, you experience the following effects:
  • You must expend 1 extra foot of movement for every foot you move using your speed.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage.
  • You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws.

Stunned

While stunned, you experience the following effects:
  • You are incapacitated.
  • You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage.

Suffocating

While you are suffocating, keep track of how many rounds go by. For a number of rounds equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round), nothing happens. At the start of your next turn, you drop to 0 hit points and are dying, and you can't regain hit points or be stabilized until you can breathe again.
You can hold your breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds). After that, you start suffocating.

Taunted

While taunted by a creature, you have disadvantage on attacks against all creatures except the one taunting you.
If a creature taunts you while you are already taunted, the first taunt ends.
This condition can be commonly applied via the Taunt action.

Transformed

While transformed into a creature, you experience the following effects:
  • Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the creature, including hit points, Hit Dice, and mental ability scores. You retain your alignment and personality. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.
  • You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form. You can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech, unless your new form is capable of such actions. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, nor prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell that you've already cast.
  • Your equipment melds into your new form and has no effect.
While transformed into an object, you experience the following effects:
  • Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the object.
  • Your equipment melds into your new form and has no effect.
  • You are incapacitated and are unaware of your surroundings.
  • You have no memory of time spent in this form.
When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed, assuming you didn't die. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form.

Unconscious

While unconscious, you experience the following effects:
  • You are incapacitated and are unaware of your surroundings.
  • You drop whatever you're holding and fall prone.
  • You automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage.
  • Any attack that hits you is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of you.
You fall unconscious when you are reduced to 0 hit pointsYou also start dying if there was excess damage.. When you fall unconscious in this way, you wake up if you regain any hit points, and you automatically regain 1 hit point after 1d4 hours.
○
×
Tarantula

Tarantula

Tiny Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 2 (1d4)
Speed: walk 15 ft., climb 15 ft., burrow 5 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
2 (-4)16 (+3)9 (-1)1 (-5)10 (+0)1 (-5)
Skills: Stealth
Senses: tremorsense 5 ft.
Druid Level: 6
Cling Climb. The tarantula can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
Web Walker. The tarantula ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 1d4 poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Bristles. The tarantula sprays barbed bristles in a 5-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1 piercing damage and be blinded by the hairs (save ends).
(2 AP) Multiattack. The tarantula makes two Bite attacks.

Vulnerabilities: Thunder
Senses: blindsight 600 ft.
Druid Level: 6
Echolocation. The dolphin can't use its blindsight while deafened.
Hit and Run. When the dolphin makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hit or not.
Hold Breath. The dolphin can hold its breath for up to 10 minutes.
Keen Hearing. The dolphin has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing.

Attacks

Slam. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d10 + 2 bludgeoning damage.
Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d4 + 2 piercing damage, and if the target is two or more sizes smaller than the dolphin, it is grappled.

Special Actions

(3 AP) Rush. The dolphin moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement, and then makes a Slam attack with advantage. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 1d10 damage.

Hold Breath. The sea lion can hold its breath for up to 10 minutes.
Pack Tactics. The sea lion's attacks deal an extra 1d6 damage to flanked creatures.

Druid Level: 6

Nautilus

Nautilus

Tiny Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 18 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 3 (1d4)
Speed: swim 10 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
3 (-4)14 (+2)10 (+0)4 (-3)12 (+1)4 (-3)
Druid Level: 6
Hold Breath. While out of water, the nautilus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.
Water Breathing. The nautilus can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Tentacle. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: The target is grappled. The nautilus has 20 tentacles to grapple with. A creature of the same size as the nautilus or smaller that is grappled by three or more tentacles is restrained.
Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP, Repeatable) Tentacles. The nautilus makes two Tentacle attacks.
(1 AP) Withdraw. The nautilus withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges as a free action, it can't attack, it's prone, it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it gains a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The nautilus makes two Tentacle attacks and a Beak attack.

×
Swordfish

Swordfish

Medium Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12
Hit Points: 15 (3d8)
Speed: swim 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
10 (+0)14 (+2)11 (+0)2 (-4)15 (+2)2 (-4)
Saving Throws: Str
Druid Level: 6
Water Breathing. The swordfish can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Sword. Melee weapon attack; reach. Hit: 1d10 + 2 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(3 AP) Rush. The swordfish moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement, and then makes a Sword attack with advantage. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 1d10 damage.
»
○
×
stunned

Stunned

While stunned, you experience the following effects:
  • You are incapacitated.
  • You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
  • Attack rolls against you have advantage.
○
×
Lightning Eel

Lightning Eel

Small Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 13
Hit Points: 6 (1d6)
Speed: swim 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
5 (-3)16 (+3)14 (+2)2 (-4)13 (+1)3 (-4)
Resistances: Lightning
Druid Level: 6
Water Breathing. The eel can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 3 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Wriggle Away. The eel can make a saving throw to escape a grapple.
(2 AP) Discharge (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest). Each target within 5 feet of the eel must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 lightning damage, or half as much on a success. A target that fails the save by 5 or more is also stunned until the end of the eel's next turn. Other lightning eels automatically succeed on the save.

Druid Level: 6

False Appearance. While the crab remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a rock.

Druid Level: 8

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The cat makes two Claws attacks and a Bite attack.
(3 AP) Pounce. The cat moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement, and then makes a Claws attack. If the cat moved at least 10 feet and the attack hits, the target is grappled and the cat can additionally make a Bite attack against it.

Druid Level: 8

Quills. The hedgehog is covered in quills. A creature that hits it with an unarmed melee attack takes 1 piercing damage from the quills.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Defensive Curl. The hedgehog curls up into a ball. Until it uncurls itself (no action required), its speed is 0, it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it gains a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.

Eagle

Small Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12
Hit Points: 10 (2d6)
Speed: walk 10 ft., fly 50 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
7 (-2)15 (+2)12 (+1)6 (-2)18 (+4)6 (-2)
Skills: Athletics, Perception ×2
Druid Level: 8
Eagle Eyes. The eagle doesn't suffer from passive Perception falloff when it uses its sight.
Keen Sight. The eagle has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Powerful Build. The eagle counts as one size larger than its actual size for the purpose of grappling and being grappled, determining its carrying capacity, and determining the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

Attacks

Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d6 - 2 piercing damage.
Talons. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 2d4 + 2 slashing damage, and if the target is the same size as the eagle or smaller, it is grappled. The eagle can grapple two smaller targets in this way, or one target of the eagle's size.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The eagle makes a Talons attack and a Beak attack.

Druid Level: 8

Hit and Run. When the falcon makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hit or not.
Keen Sight. The falcon has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Attacks

Beak. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 3 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Sprint. The falcon moves up to half its speed.
(3 AP) Divebomb. The falcon flies up to twice its speed at any downwards angle. It then makes a Beak attack with advantage. If the attack hits and the target is no more than 1 size larger than the falcon, the target falls prone.

×
Dire Wolf

Dire Wolf

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 32 (4d10)
Speed: walk 50 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
18 (+4)10 (+0)15 (+2)6 (-2)13 (+1)6 (-2)
Skills: Athletics ×2, Perception ×2, Survival ×2
Resistances: Cold
Druid Level: 8
Keen Smell. The wolf has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.
Long-Limbed. The wolf ignores difficult terrain due to deep snow.
Pack Tactics. The wolf's attacks deal an extra 2d6 damage to flanked creatures.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 2d8 + 4 piercing damage, and if the target is the same size as the wolf or smaller, it is grappled. Additionally, the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
A creature that is grappled by two or more wolves in this way is restrained unless it is two or more sizes larger than the wolves.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The wolf makes two Bite attacks.
(2 AP) Howl. The wolf howls, and is audible for at least 1000 feet. The wolf and each of its allies that hears the howl gains 3d4 temporary hit points, and can't gain temporary hit points from any dire wolf's Howl again until it finishes a short or long rest. Additionally, each of the wolf's allies that hears the howl can repeat a saving throw against each effect causing it to be frightened.
○
×
Tundra Bison

Tundra Bison

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 16 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 54 (6d10)
Speed: walk 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
19 (+4)9 (-1)17 (+3)5 (-3)8 (-1)4 (-3)
Skills: Athletics
Resistances: Cold
Druid Level: 8
Bloodied Rage. When the bison is bloodied, its weapon attack rolls have advantage.
Group Defense. The bison can't be flanked while it has an ally with the Group Defense trait within 5 feet of it that isn't incapacitated.
Poor Sight. The bison has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Powerful Build. The bison counts as one size larger than its actual size for the purpose of grappling and being grappled, determining its carrying capacity, and determining the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

Attacks

Horns. Melee weapon attack; reach. Hit: 2d10 + 4 piercing damage, and if the target is smaller than the bison, it is pushed up to 10 feet and knocked prone

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The bison makes two Horns attacks.
(3 AP) Trampling Charge. The bison moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement. During this movement, it can enter the spaces of smaller creatures. If it enters the space of a prone creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 bludgeoning damage. If it enters the space of a non-prone creature, it makes a Horns attack against it.

Giant Elk

Giant Elk

Huge Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 45 (5d12)
Speed: walk 50 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
18 (+4)14 (+2)14 (+2)5 (-3)12 (+1)6 (-2)
Druid Level: 8
Long-Limbed. The elk ignores difficult terrain due to deep snow.

Attacks

Antlers (Male Only). Melee weapon attack; reach. Hit: 2d10 + 4 piercing damage.
Hooves. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d4 + 4 bludgeoning damage.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The elk makes two Antlers or Hooves attacks.
(2 AP) Sweeping Rack (Male Only). Each creature within reach of the elk's Antlers makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 4d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
(3 AP) Tossing Charge (Male Only). The elk moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement, and then makes an Antlers attack against each creature within reach and in the direction of the line. Each creature smaller than the elk that's hit by one of these attacks is thrown up to 20 feet vertically and horizontally, potentially taking fall damage when it lands.

Murder Wasp

Murder Wasp

Minuscule Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14
Hit Points: 2 (2d1)
Speed: walk 5 ft., climb 5 ft., fly 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
2 (-4)19 (+4)11 (+0)1 (-5)11 (+0)2 (-4)
Druid Level: 8
Evasive Flight. If the wasp is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It must be flying to use this trait.
Flyby. The wasp doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies.
Swarm Frenzy. When there is at least one ally within 5 feet of the wasp that isn't incapacitated, the wasp gains an additional action point on each of its turns.

Attacks

Sting. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 4d6 poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned (save ends), taking ($glossary#conditions.ongoing_damage) 1 poison damage while poisoned in this way. If the target was already poisoned by a previous Sting attack, it instead becomes incapacitated while poisoned and the ongoing damage increases by 1.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The wasp makes two Sting attacks.

×
Assassin Spider

Assassin Spider

Minuscule Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 14
Hit Points: 3 (3d1)
Speed: walk 20 ft., climb 20 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
1 (-5)19 (+4)8 (-1)1 (-5)14 (+2)1 (-5)
Skills: Athletics, Stealth ×2
Senses: tremorsense 5 ft.
Druid Level: 8
Cling Climb. The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
Standing Leap. The spider doesn't need to take a running start when it Jumps.
Web Walker. The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1 poison damage and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. If this poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Silk Tether. The spider tethers itself to its space with silk. Until it cuts the tether as a free action or the tether takes any slashing damage (it has 10 AC), the spider can't be moved away from the spot. The spider can willingly move away from the spot by extending the length of the tether. It can also retract the tether by spending 1 foot of movement per foot retracted, bringing it closer to the spot without provoking opportunity attacks.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The spider makes two Bite attacks.
○

Hairy Maneater

Hairy Maneater

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 18 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 54 (6d10)
Speed: walk 35 ft., climb 20 ft., burrow 5 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
15 (+2)16 (+3)16 (+3)1 (-5)9 (-1)1 (-5)
Skills: Stealth
Senses: tremorsense 5 ft.
Druid Level: 8
Cling Climb. The maneater can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
Web Sense. While in contact with a web, the maneater knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.
Web Walker. The maneater ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 2d8 + 3 piercing damage and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. If this poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.
Silk Garrote. Melee weapon attack; finesse, reach. Hit: If the target is smaller than the maneater, it is restrained by silk cords. The target is suffocating while restrained in this way. The target or another creature can use a standard action and make a DC 17 Strength check to break the silk and free the target. Any slashing damage dealt to the silk also frees the target (the silk has 13 AC).

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The maneater makes two Silk Garrote attacks and a Bite attack, or two Bite attacks.
(1 AP) Bristles. The maneater sprays barbed bristles in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d4 piercing damage and be blinded by the hairs (save ends).

×
False Dragon

False Dragon

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 48 (6d10)
Speed: walk 30 ft., climb 15 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
18 (+4)12 (+1)15 (+2)4 (-3)12 (+1)7 (-2)
Saving Throws: Dex
Skills: Athletics, Stealth
Druid Level: 8
Keen Smell. The false dragon has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 3d6 + 4 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take ongoing 1d6 acid damage. If the target is already afflicted by this ongoing damage, the ongoing damage increases by 1d6 instead. Additionally, if the target is the same size as the lizard or smaller, it is grappled. While grappled in this way, the target automatically fails its saving throws against the ongoing damage, including the initial save.
While the lizard is grappling a creature in this way, it has advantage on Bite and Claws attacks against that creature, and it can't Bite a different creature.
Claws. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 2d6 + 4 slashing damage.
Tail. Melee weapon attack; finesse, reach, unarmed. Hit: 1d4 + 4 bludgeoning damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP, Repeatable) Quick Attack. The false dragon makes a Tail attack.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The false dragon makes a Bite attack and two Claws attacks.
(3 AP) Rush. The false dragon moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement, and then makes a Claws or Bite attack with advantage. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 2d6 damage.

Medium Beast, Unaligned

Hit Points: 18 (3d8)

STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
15 (+2)10 (+0)13 (+1)2 (-4)15 (+2)3 (-4)

Keen Smell. The shark has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.
Rough Skin. A creature that hits the shark with an unarmed attack takes 1 slashing damage.
Water Breathing. The shark can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The shark makes two Bite attacks.
(1 AP) Swallow. The shark attempts to swallow one creature grappled by its Bite. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be swallowed. While swallowed, the target is restrained, takes ongoing 2d6 acid plus 1d6 bludgeoning damage, and has total cover from everything except the shark's stomach.
If a swallowed creature deals damage to the shark, the shark must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or vomit each swallowed creature out to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the shark. The DC equals the damage dealt.
»
○
×
difficult terrain

Difficult Terrain

Every foot of movement in difficult terrain costs 1 extra foot. This rule is true even if multiple things in a space count as difficult terrain.
Low furniture, rubble, undergrowth, steep stairs, snow, and shallow bogs are examples of difficult terrain. The space of another creature, whether hostile or not, also counts as difficult terrain.
»
○
×
squeezing

Space

Your size determines how much space you occupy. In combat, you normally occupy a square with a side length given by the Normal column of the Creature Sizes table below. This area, often refered to as "your space," represents the space you need to move and fight unhindered. You control your space, and can prevent other creatures within 1 size category of yourself from sharing it. Additionally, your space counts as both difficult terrain and half cover for all creatures other than yourself.
You do not have to occupy your normal amount of space. If you occupy less, whether by choice or by force, you suffer penalties.

Squeezing

Squeezing can reduce one or both side lengths of your space down to the value in the Squeezing column of the Creature Sizes table. You are slowed while squeezing.

Stuck

The value in the Stuck column of the Creature Sizes table is the minimum side length your area of control can have. If at least one side length of your area of control is between the "Stuck" and "Squeezing" values, you are stuck. While stuck, you are restrained. You can use a standard action to make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. On a success, you are slowed instead of restrained until the end of the current turn.

Crushed

You cannot willingly reduce a side length of your space to less than the value in the Stuck column of the Creature Sizes table. If you are forced to, you immediately take 1d10 bludgeoning damage for each inch your space's shorter side length subceeds your Stuck value, and you are crushed. You take this damage again at the end of each of your turns as long as you remain crushed. You are also stuck while crushed, and the DC to try to move increases by 1 for each inch your space's shorter side length subceeds your Stuck value.
Creature Sizes
SizeNormalSqueezingStuck
Minuscule≤1 ft.≤6 in.≤1 in.
Tiny2 ft.1 ft.6 in.
Small3 ft.2 ft.1 ft.
Medium5 ft.3 ft.2 ft.
Large10 ft.5 ft.3 ft.
Huge15 ft.10 ft.5 ft.
Gargantuan≥20 ft.≥15 ft.≥10 ft.
○
×
Octopus

Octopus

Small Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 16
Hit Points: 4 (1d6)
Speed: walk 5 ft., swim 20 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
4 (-3)23 (+6)10 (+0)7 (-2)15 (+2)7 (-2)
Saving Throws: Dex, Int
Skills: Athletics, Deception, Investigation ×2, Stealth ×2
Druid Level: 8
Amorphous. The octopus can move in a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.
Hold Breath. While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.
Underwater Camouflage. The octopus has advantage on Stealth checks made to Hide underwater, and it only needs to be lightly obscured to do so.
Water Breathing. The octopus can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Tentacle. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: The target is grappled. The octopus has 8 tentacles to grapple with. A creature of the same size as the octopus or smaller that is grappled by two or more tentacles is restrained.
Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP, Repeatable) Tentacles. The octopus makes three Tentacle attacks.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The octopus makes two Tentacle attacks and a Beak attack.
(1 AP) Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). A 5-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink.
○
×
Devil Jellyfish

Devil Jellyfish

Tiny Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 6
Hit Points: 18 (3d4)
Speed: swim 5 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
1 (-5)3 (-4)17 (+3)1 (-5)1 (-5)1 (-5)
Immunities: Poison
Senses: blindsight 5 ft.
Druid Level: 8
Bioluminescence. The jellyfish sheds dim light out to a radius of 5 feet.
Deep Diver. The jellyfish can withstand extreme underwater depths.
Eyeless. The jellyfish is permanently blinded.
Stinging Tentacles. A creature that touches the jellyfish must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 8d6 poison damage, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails by 5 or more is also poisoned (save ends), and is paralyzed and takes ongoing 4d6 poison damage while poisoned in this way.
Water Breathing. The jellyfish can breathe only underwater.

Special Actions

(0 AP) Drift. The jellyfish swims. Each creature within 5 feet of the jellyfish at any point during the movement is exposed to its Stinging Tentacles and must make a save against the effect.

Hit Points: 66 (6d12)
Speed: walk 40 ft., burrow 10 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
23 (+6)10 (+0)19 (+4)7 (-2)13 (+1)8 (-1)
Saving Throws: Con

Senses: darkvision 30 ft.
Druid Level: 10
Dirt Shield. When the bear burrows through dirt or mud, its fur traps earth and small rocks and the bear gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the distance burrowed. These temporary hit points are cumulative, but the bear can't accumulate more than 20.
Hibernator. When the bear takes a short rest, it automatically rolls the maximum value on any hit dice it spends to regain hit points.
Keen Smell. The bear has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Attacks

Claws. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 2d10 + 6 slashing damage.
Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 2d12 + 6 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The bear makes two Claws attacks and a Bite attack.
○
×
Great Eagle

Great Eagle

Large Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12
Hit Points: 35 (5d10)
Speed: walk 20 ft., fly 60 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
16 (+3)15 (+2)13 (+1)7 (-2)18 (+4)8 (-1)
Skills: Athletics, Perception ×2
Druid Level: 10
Eagle Eyes. The eagle doesn't suffer from passive Perception falloff when it uses its sight.
Keen Sight. The eagle has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Attacks

Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d8 + 3 piercing damage.
Talons. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 2d6 + 3 slashing damage, and if the target is the same size as the eagle or smaller, it is grappled. The eagle can grapple two smaller targets in this way, or one target of the eagle's size.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The eagle makes two Talons attacks and a Beak attack.
○
×
Storm Falcon

Storm Falcon

Medium Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 15 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 15 (3d8)
Speed: walk 5 ft., fly 90 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
10 (+0)19 (+4)11 (+0)8 (-1)19 (+4)6 (-2)
Skills: Stealth, Acrobatics ×2, Perception ×2
Senses: darkvision 300 ft.
Druid Level: 10
Eagle Eyes. The falcon doesn't suffer from passive Perception falloff when it uses its sight.
Hit and Run. When the falcon makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hit or not.
Keen Sight. The falcon has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Storm Camouflage. The falcon has advantage on Stealth checks made to Hide in clouds or rain, and it only needs to be lightly obscured to do so.
Storm Sight. Within the range of its darkvision, the falcon sees through lightly obscured clouds, mists, and rain as if it were clear, and through heavily obscured clouds, mists, and rain as if it were lightly obscured.

Attacks

Beak. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 2d8 + 4 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Sprint. The falcon moves up to half its speed.
(1 AP) Vanish. The falcon takes the Hide action. It must be in cloud cover or rain to use this action.
(3 AP) Divebomb. The falcon flies up to twice its speed at any downwards angle. It then makes a Beak attack with advantage. If the attack hits and the target is no more than 1 size larger than the falcon, the target falls prone.
○
×
Elephant

Elephant

Huge Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 100 (10d12)
Speed: walk 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
22 (+6)9 (-1)17 (+3)8 (-1)11 (+0)7 (-2)
Skills: Athletics
Druid Level: 10
Group Defense. The elephant can't be flanked while it has an ally with the Group Defense trait within 5 feet of it that isn't incapacitated.

Attacks

Tusk. Melee weapon attack; reach. Hit: 2d12 + 6 piercing damage, and if the target is smaller than the elephant, it is pushed up to 10 feet.
Trunk. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 6 bludgeoning damage, and if the target is smaller than the elephant, it is grappled. If the target is smaller by two or more sizes, it is restrained while grappled in this way.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The elephant makes two Tusk attacks.
(1 AP) Quick Grab. The elephant makes a Trunk attack.
(3 AP) Trampling Charge. The elephant moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement. During this movement, it can enter the spaces of smaller creatures. If it enters the space of a prone creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 bludgeoning damage. If it enters the space of a non-prone creature, it makes a Tusk attack against it.

×
Desert Cobra

Desert Cobra

Medium Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 17 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 28 (4d8)
Speed: burrow 10 ft., crawl 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
12 (+1)23 (+6)15 (+2)4 (-3)15 (+2)2 (-4)
Saving Throws: Str
Skills: Intimidation, Stealth
Senses: blindsight 10 ft.
Druid Level: 10
Keen Smell. The snake has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.
Poor Hearing and Sight. The snake has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 6 piercing damage plus 4d6 poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned (save ends). While poisoned in this way, the target takes ongoing 4d6 poison damage and is paralyzed due to excruciating pain and nerve damage. If the ongoing damage of this bite deals a cumulative total of 20 damage or more, the target is slowed until it finishes a long rest or is healed by a spell such as lesser restoration.
Spit Venom. Ranged weapon attack; range 10/30. Hit: 1 poison damage, and the target is blinded until it uses a major action to clear its eyes.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The cobra makes two Bite or Spit Venom attacks.

Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA

Skills: Stealth
Senses: blindsight 10 ft.
Druid Level: 10
Desert Camouflage. The scorpion has advantage on Stealth checks made to Hide in sand or sandstone, and it only needs to be lightly obscured to do so.

Attacks

Pincers. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and if the target is the same size or smaller than the scorpion, it is grappled. The scorpion has two pincers to grapple with.
Sting. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 1d6 poison damage, and the target is must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned (save ends). While poisoned in this way, the target takes ongoing 10d6 piercing damage due to profuse bleeding. The target takes 5d6 piercing damage when it succeeds on a saving throw against this effect.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The scorpion makes two Pincers attacks.
(1 AP, Repeatable) Quick Attack. The scorpion makes a Sting attack.

White Shark

White Shark

Huge Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 16 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 80 (8d12)
Speed: swim 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
24 (+7)9 (-1)16 (+3)3 (-4)15 (+2)5 (-3)
Saving Throws: Dex, Con
Skills: Stealth, Athletics ×2, Perception ×2
Senses: blindsight 10 ft.
Druid Level: 10
Blood Frenzy. The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against bloodied creatures.
Keen Smell. The shark has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.
Rough Skin. A creature that hits the shark with an unarmed attack takes 2d4 slashing damage.
Water Breathing. The shark can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 6d6 + 7 piercing damage, and if the target is smaller than the shark, it is grappled. If the shark is grappling a creature in this way, it can't Bite any other target.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The shark makes three Bite attacks.
(1 AP) Swallow. The shark attempts to swallow one creature grappled by its Bite. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be swallowed. While swallowed, the target is restrained, takes ongoing 4d6 acid plus 2d6 bludgeoning damage, and has total cover from everything except the shark's stomach.
If a swallowed creature deals damage to the shark, the shark must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or vomit each swallowed creature out to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the shark. The DC equals the damage dealt.

Ringed Octopus

Ringed Octopus

Tiny Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 17
Hit Points: 3 (1d4)
Speed: walk 5 ft., swim 15 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
2 (-4)24 (+7)10 (+0)7 (-2)15 (+2)7 (-2)
Saving Throws: Dex, Int
Skills: Intimidation, Stealth ×2
Druid Level: 10
Amorphous. The octopus can move in a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.
Hold Breath. While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.
Warning Colors. The octopus is brightly colored, signaling its venemous Bite to other beasts and any creature with an Intelligence score of 10 or higher. The octopus also has disadvantage on Stealth checks.
Water Breathing. The octopus can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Tentacle. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: The target is grappled. The octopus has 8 tentacles to grapple with. A creature of the same size as the octopus or smaller that is grappled by two or more tentacles is restrained.
Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is poisoned (save ends). A creature is paralyzed and suffocating while poisoned in this way.

Special Actions

(1 AP, Repeatable) Tentacles. The octopus makes two Tentacle attacks.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The octopus makes a Tentacle attack and a Beak attack.

Razor Squid

Medium Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 12
Hit Points: 6 (1d8)
Speed: swim 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +2
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
12 (+1)15 (+2)12 (+1)5 (-3)15 (+2)6 (-2)

Druid Level: 10

Keen Sight. The squid has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Pack Tactics. The squid's attacks deal an extra 1d6 damage to flanked creatures.
Water Breathing. The squid can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Long Tentacle. Melee weapon attack; finesse, reach, unarmed. Hit: 1d6 + 2 slashing damage, and if the target is the same size as the squid or smaller, it is pulled up to 5 feet.
Short Tentacle. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d6 + 2 slashing damage, and the target is grappled. The squid has 8 short tentacles to grapple with. A creature of the same size as the squid or smaller that is grappled by two or more short tentacles is restrained.
Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 1d8 + 1 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Flee. The squid takes either the Disengage or Dash action.
(1 AP, Repeatable) Tentacles. The squid makes two Long Tentacle attacks.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The squid makes three Short Tentacle attacks and a Beak attack.
(1 AP) Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). A 10-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the squid if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink.

Hit Points: 72 (8d12)
Speed: walk 20 ft., swim 50 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
20 (+5)11 (+0)14 (+2)6 (-2)14 (+2)5 (-3)

Druid Level: 12
Hold Breath. The crocodile can hold its breath for up to 1 hour.
Powerful Jaws. A creature grappled by the crocodile's Bite has disadvantage on saving throws made to escape.

Attacks

Bite. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 3d8 + 5 piercing damage, and if the target the same size as the crocodile or smaller, it is grappled. While grappled in this way, the target is also restrained.
Tail. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 1d10 + 5 bludgeoning damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP) Clench Teeth. If the crocodile has a creature grappled by its Bite, the creature takes 2d4 piercing damage.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The crocodile makes two Bite attacks and a Tail attack.
(3 AP) Death Roll. The crocodile spins violently in water to devastate its prey. It must be swimming to use this action. A creature grappled by the crocodile's Bite makes a DC 16 Strength saving throw, taking 8d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

Druid Level: 12

Mist Camouflage. The boa has advantage on Stealth checks made to Hide in mist, and it only needs to be lightly obscured to do so.

Bite. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 2d10 + 7 piercing damage, and the target is grappled.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The boa makes three Bite attacks.
(2 AP) Constrict. The boa wraps itself around a creature it is grappling with its Bite. The creature is restrained for the duration of the grapple if it is the same size as the boa or smaller. While restrained in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Strength saving throws made to escape the grapple.
(1 AP) Crush. The boa tightens its grasp around a creature it is restraining with its Constrict. The target takes 8d6 bludgeoning damage and begins suffocating until the end of the boa's next turn or until it's no longer restrained by the boa.

Vulnerabilities: Thunder

Hold Breath. The orca can hold its breath for up to 10 minutes.
Keen Hearing. The orca has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing.
Pack Tactics. The orca's attacks deal an extra 2d8 damage to flanked creatures.

Slam. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 2d12 + 5 bludgeoning damage, and if the target is smaller than the orca, it is pushed up to 10 feet in any direction.

Giant Octopus

Giant Octopus

Large Beast, Unaligned

Hit Points: 42 (6d10)
Speed: walk 10 ft., swim 30 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
14 (+2)22 (+6)12 (+1)7 (-2)15 (+2)7 (-2)

Skills: Deception, Athletics ×2, Investigation ×2, Stealth ×2
Druid Level: 12
Amorphous. The octopus can move in a space as narrow as 6 inches without squeezing.
Hold Breath. While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 1 hour.
Underwater Camouflage. The octopus has advantage on Stealth checks made to Hide underwater, and it only needs to be lightly obscured to do so.
Water Breathing. The octopus can breathe only underwater.

Attacks

Tentacle. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 1d1 + 6 bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled. The octopus has 8 tentacles to grapple with. A creature of the same size as the octopus or smaller that is grappled by two or more tentacles is restrained.
Beak. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 2d8 + 2 piercing damage.

Special Actions

(1 AP, Repeatable) Tentacles. The octopus makes three Tentacle attacks.
(2 AP) Crushing Beak. The octopus makes a Beak attack against a restrained creature. For this attack, the target's AC equals 10 + the target's Dexterity modifier. If the attack hits, it is automatically a critical hit and the target's armor is destroyed.
(2 AP) Multiattack. The octopus makes two Tentacle attacks and a Beak attack.
(1 AP) Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink.

Steppe Rhinoceros

Huge Beast, Unaligned

Hit Points: 104 (8d12)
Speed: walk 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +3
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
24 (+7)7 (-2)22 (+6)4 (-3)6 (-2)4 (-3)
Skills: Athletics
Druid Level: 14
Bloodied Rage. When the rhinoceros is bloodied, its weapon attack rolls have advantage.
Poor Sight. The rhinoceros has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
Powerful Build. The rhinoceros counts as one size larger than its actual size for the purpose of grappling and being grappled, determining its carrying capacity, and determining the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

Attacks

Horn. Melee weapon attack; unarmed. Hit: 4d12 + 7 piercing damage, and if the target is the same size or smaller than the rhinoceros, it is pushed up to 15 feet and knocked prone

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The rhinoceros makes three Horn attacks.
(3 AP) Trampling Charge. The rhinoceros moves in a straight line up to its speed using that speed's natural movement. During this movement, it can enter the spaces of smaller creatures. If it enters the space of a prone creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 bludgeoning damage. If it enters the space of a non-prone creature, it makes a Horns attack against it.

Roc

Roc

Gargantuan Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 11 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 256 (16d20)
Speed: walk 30 ft., fly 80 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +4
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
28 (+9)10 (+0)20 (+5)9 (-1)13 (+1)9 (-1)
Saving Throws: Wis, Cha
Skills: Athletics, Perception ×2
Druid Level: 16
Eagle Eyes. The eagle doesn't suffer from passive Perception falloff when it uses its sight.
Keen Sight. The roc has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Attacks

Beak. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 4d10 + 9 piercing damage.
Talons. Melee weapon attack; finesse, unarmed. Hit: 4d6 + 9 slashing damage, and if the target is the same size as the roc or smaller, it is grappled. If the target is two or more sizes smaller than the roc, this grapple only requires one foot.

Special Actions

(1 AP, Repeatable) Attack. The roc makes two Talons attacks and a Beak attack.
(1 AP, Repeatable) Hurl. The roc whips in the air, hurling a creature or object in one of its talons. The roc makes an Athletics check and can hurl the target a number of feet equal 5 times the result in any direction. The horizontal traveled as part of the hurl counts as falling for the purpose of fall damage. If the thrown target would hit a creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take bludgeoning damage equal to the thrown target's fall damage.
(1 AP, Repeatable) Wing Buffet. The roc flaps its wings, making a gust of wind. Each creature within 10 feet of the roc that isn't grappled by it must make a 21 21 Strength saving throw. A creature is pushed up to 20 feet and knocked prone on a failed save, or is pushed up to 10 feet and isn't knocked prone on a success.

Druid Level: 16

»
○
×
dazed

Dazed

While you are dazed, you experience the following effects:
  • On each of your turns, you have 1 less action point, and you can't take the Move action.
  • You can't take reactions.
  • You have disadvantage on saving throws you make to maintain concentration (including on the saving throw triggered by the effect that dazed you, if it triggered such a save).
○
×
Deep Whale

Deep Whale

Gargantuan Beast, Unaligned
Armor Class: 9
Hit Points: 288 (16d20)
Speed: swim 40 ft.
Proficiency Bonus: +4
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
26 (+8)8 (-1)24 (+7)7 (-2)16 (+3)7 (-2)
Skills: Perception
Resistances: Cold
Vulnerabilities: Thunder
Senses: blindsight 300 ft., darkvision 300 ft.
Druid Level: 16
Deep Diver. The whale can withstand extreme underwater depths.
Echolocation. The whale can't use its blindsight while deafened.
Hold Breath. The whale can hold its breath for up to 2 hours.
Keen Hearing. The whale has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing.

Attacks

Slam. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 8d12 + 8 bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 30 feet in any direction.
Bite. Melee weapon attack; reach, unarmed. Hit: 8d8 + 8 piercing damage, and if the target is smaller than the whale, it is grappled.

Special Actions

(2 AP) Multiattack. The whale makes a Bite attack and a Slam attack.
(2 AP) Sonic Blast. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 thunder damage and be dazed until the end of the whale's next turn, or half as much damage and no daze on a success. A creature that fails by 10 or more is stunned instead of dazed.
»
○
×
Magic

Magic

Cost: varies (repeatable)
When you take the Magic action, you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, or you use a feature or a magic item that requires a Magic action to be activated. This use of the Magic action costs a number of AP determined by the spell, feature, or magic item.
If you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 minute or longer, you must take the Magic action on each turn of that casting, and you must maintain concentration while you do so. This use of the Magic action costs 2 AP. If your concentration is broken, the spell fails, but you don't expend a spell slot.
This action is repeatable, but you can only use it to cast one non-cantrip spell per turn.
○
×
Companion

Companion

A creature with the Companion trait follows the commands of its leader, which is another creature. The companion is friendly to its leader and its leader's allies.
In combat, the companion shares a turn with its leader. The companion has its own action points and movement; it just doesn't roll initiative and can interleave its actions with its leader's actions. A companion can use its reaction on its own, but it doesn't take any action that targets a creature other than itself unless its leader uses a minor action to command it to do so. If the leader is incapacitated or unable to contact the companion, the companion can take any actions of its choice.
If the companion's statblock has "PB" in it, that refers to its leader's proficiency bonus.
»
○
×
armor of ice

Armor of Ice

1st-level abjuration
Components
V, S, M (a cup of water)
Duration
1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as a spectral frost that covers you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot level above 1st.
Available To
Warlock
Source
PHB
»
○
×
binding ice

Binding Ice

2nd-level evocation
Components
S, M (a vial of meltwater)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self (30-foot cone)
A burst of cold energy emanates from you in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d8 cold damage and is hindered by ice formations for 1 minute, or until it or another creature within reach of it uses a standard action to break away the ice. A creature hindered by ice has its speed reduced to 0. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't hindered by ice.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the cold damage by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.
Available To
Sorcerer, wizard
Source
FTD
»
○
×
mirror image

Mirror Image

2nd-level illusion
Components
V, S
Duration
1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use a standard action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.
Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the spell's duration, roll a d20 to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.
If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.
A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.
A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.
Available To
Bard, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB, TCE
»
○
×
scrying

Scrying

5th-level divination
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water)
Duration
Up to 10 minutes
Casting Time
10 minutes
Range
Self
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.
KnowledgeSave Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (you have met the target)+0
Familiar (you know the target well)-5
ConnectionSave Modifier
Likeness or picture-2
Possession or garment-4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like-10
On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.
On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.
Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.
Available To
Bard, cleric, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB
»
○
×
silent image

Silent Image

1st-level illusion
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a bit of fleece)
Duration
Up to 10 minutes
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.
You can use a standard action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking.
Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses a standard action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image.
Available To
Bard, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB
»
○
×
wall of sand

Wall of Sand

3rd-level evocation
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a handful of sand)
Duration
Up to 10 minutes
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
90 feet
You create a wall of swirling sand on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick, and it vanishes when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is blinded while in the walls space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there.
Available To
Wizard
Source
EEPC, XGE
»
